instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: keyboard connector issue <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: I replaced a keyboard connector on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board and everything works except a couple keys: enter key, question mark, backslash, p, zero keys. I've zoomed in on pins and can see clearly no bridges on pins, all pins are solid to board and inside the connector the distances between the top and bottom pins are the same with door closed on the connector. Figured it must be the keyboard and tried a new keyboard and same keys are not working... could this be board trace on one of the pins?

threads.title: keyboard connector issue <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Check the trace for pin 9 of KB connector.

Too check all keys...
[URL unfurl="true"]https://keyboardchecker.com/[/URL]
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.keyboardtester.com/[/URL]

threads.title: keyboard connector issue <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
tried reflowing j4813. will run a new trace if I can verify it's not there had to get different boardview.
Keys not working: 
esc
f10
f11
zero
hyphen
p
backslash
colon
return
question mark

threads.title: keyboard connector issue <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Also to note: 
this runs slow unless in Safe Mode... almost like its getting inputs that arent there? theres often a lag between key press or mouse movement and visual change on screen. This mac had a liquid spill and when i got, however looked at it prior broke the keyboard connector and the fan connector. Board had been cleaned as there was no evidence of liquid visible.

threads.title: keyboard connector issue <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: ran jumper from pin 9 j4813 to pin 15 <CHIP>U4820</CHIP> and no change in keys working.

threads.title: keyboard connector issue <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
I think my layout note is from an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> machine.
All mentioned keys are connected to pin 9 there.

Use a tweezer and make contacts between pin 9 and one of 10-12, 15-19, or 20-24.
If you get the above characters, then the problem is the connector.
Pins 11, 20, and 22 maybe don't generate anything (with pin 9).

threads.title: keyboard connector issue <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
It would've helped had I ran a trace to pin 9 and not pin 10!!!! Apparently I couldn't count to 9 yesterday. Keyboard works with jumper to pin 15 of <CHIP>U4820</CHIP>. 
Something is scrambling this Mac though. As stated before it runs right on Safe Boot but regular boot there's a lag. Fresh install of Catalina. I tried booting off external El Capitan and same lag so it doesn't appear to be related to SSD. 

Any suggestions? This had liquid damage but only noticeable evidence of that is red dot on battery and feedback from seller. Board had to have been at least cleaned. No noticeable residue. I believe the fan connector and keyboard connector were damaged by previous tech as prior owner said it worked some prior to taking it to repair shop. I assume then they broke the connector and then it appeared it was dead as the power button wouldn't have worked.

threads.title: keyboard connector issue <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Run corresponding EFI ASD (if possible) and see if any error pops up.
You may need to clean ME in BIOS.

threads.title: keyboard connector issue <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
I didn't note this previously but this is 00138 board.
Tried clean ME still high fans and runs sluggish.

Can't get diagnostics to finish. It freezes. USB lights go off when it's frozen, BUT... hardware monitor says CPU Power Supply 2 is drawing 3 amps

threads.title: keyboard connector issue <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
No ASD available for 2015 machine.
Try known good battery first.

threads.title: keyboard connector issue <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
New battery, no change. High fans and slow, delay in mouse, keyboard response.

Attached readings from HW monitor...

threads.title: keyboard connector issue <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
New chinese battery???

Try another trackpad board/flex and RIO board/flex too.
Also try disconnecting webcam.

threads.title: keyboard connector issue <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Tried swapping out many of the external to logic components and disconnecting to see what was different. Had one fan that was producing weird voltage on pin 4 of connector when plugged in. Replaced that and no longer have the strange voltage there but no difference. It still lags and runs high fans.  but it did finally get the hardware test to finish and gave me 3 results:
power management system ppn001
SMC PFM006
Camera NDC 001 (running without camera plugged in makes no difference in performance. The camera does work. I might be able to plug one in from different screen if it is worth trying but does it matter if it's a 2013early screen camera? I don't think I have a 15" 2013L, 2014 or 2015

threads.title: keyboard connector issue <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Given the SMC and PMS issues from the hardware self test, should SMC be next target?
